definition:
The *Bernoulli polynomials* are the sequence
$\{ b_r(x) \} _{r=0}^{\infty}$ of polynomials defined on $[0,1]$ by the
conditions: $$\begin{aligned}
b_0(x) & = & 1, \\
b'_r(x) & = & r b_{r-1}(x), r \geq 1, \\
\int_0^1 b_r(x)dx & = & 0, r \geq 1\end{aligned}$$

These assumptions imply the identity
$$\sum_{r=0}^{\infty} b_r(x) \frac{y^r}{r!} = \frac{ye^{xy}}{e^y-1}$$
allowing us to calculate the $b_r$. We have

$$\begin{aligned}
b_0(x) & = & 1 \\
b_1(x) & = & x-\frac{1}{2} \\
b_2(x) & = & x^2 - x + \frac{1}{6} \\
b_3(x) & = & x^3 - \frac{3}{2}x^2 + \frac{1}{2}x \\
b_4(x) & = & x^4 - 2x^3 + x^2 - \frac{1}{30} \\
\vdots & &\end{aligned}$$
